title: ''Πολύ καλό''
text: Το εθνικό μουσείο που μπορεί να δει κανείς και να διαβάσει για την ιστορία της Γκάμπια.Αξίζει να το επισκεφθείτε,έχει ενδιαφέρον.

title: This Lovely Museum Left Me Wanting Much More of Gambia History and Culture
text:
This well-worn museum carries many gems of the history, archeology, and music of The Gambia. The artifacts cover from the Stone Age to the present with photographs, pottery, and displays. I really enjoyed seeing the musical instruments of the various groups. These precious, valuable historical items are not well-protected and exposed to air and people touching them,  The items merit a financial investment to upgrade how the items are conserved.
Very interesting museum with sculpture park in front with 5 sculptures and a mural.
Restroom is in another building, not wheel chair accessible.

title: This is the story Gambia likes to tell about itself
text: One of my favourite things to do when travelling around the world is going to the musea where countries tell something about their national history. The National Museum of the Gambia is not like the Louvre, Uffizi of the Hermitage, but it shows on its own way a story of national struggle, pride and hope. In a way, walking around here learned me more then a guided tour in the Grand Gallery. Ask your tour guide or hotel if they could drop you off here and spend a moment of your time to look around a d have a chat with the people working here, they love to tell you more about the history of the Gambia. Don't forget to leave a tip, as they will use it for the maintenance of the museum.

title: Interesting Artifacts
text: Located in Banjul is a small two story museum loaded with exhibits that date from the stone age to the early 20th century.  The museum is dated and many of the displays are exposed to open windows and dirty.  You are warned to not touch anything and if you want to take a photo there is an extra $2 US charge.  Some of the exhibits are interesting and are not seen in other museums we visited in Africa.  I found the costumes particularly interesting.  At a leisurely pace expect to spend about 30 minutes in the museum.  There is access to a toilet just outside the entrance.

title: Fine sager
text: Museet indeholder faktisk mange spændende objekter, hvis man kigger godt efter. Landets historie, kunsthåndværk og arbejdsredskaber m.m.

title: worth a look
text:
Its not very large but crammed with interesting exhibits ,from the stone age to present day .
Its 100 Dalasie to get in and an other hundered if you take photos
Oh and dont touch anything we got told off (but in a nice way)

title: Interesting
text: A bit worn down but still very interesting. You get the story from Stone Age toEnglish Colony. You should go with a guide if possible.

title: Lief en klein museum
text:
Museum is klein dus overzichtelijk.
foto's en kostuums worden niet geconserveerd, jammer
Foto's maken tegen betaling.
Mooie verhalen van oa de beelden in de tuin.

title: Indrukwekkend door zijn eenvoud
text:
Geen opzichtig gebouw aan de Indipendence Drive in Banjul, geen gelikte presentaties met allerlei moderne, eventuele digitale, snufjes, maar heel Basic, zo zijn het onderkomen en de inrichting van het National Museum te karakteriseren. Mogelijk daarom net dat de getoonde beelden en voorwerpen, voor mij althans, harder en indrukwekkender binnenkomen dan bij een bezoek aan een modern en gesofisticeerd Westers museum. Hier is met respect voor de historie van land en volk en met bescheiden middelen een plek ingericht die de rauwe kanten van het bestaan in een Afrikaans land (toen en nu) op een bijzonder wijze belichten. De aandachtige bezoeker moet het mogelijk even op zich laten inwerken, maar wordt zondermeer geraakt. Het initiatief voor een dergelijk museum verdient veel lof.
Zeker een bezoek waard!

title: Ei hassumpi
text: Valokuvia, esineitä - ihan mielenkiintoista.  Vaikkakin nämä orja-ajat saavat voimaan pahoin ja häpeämään 😥

title: Interesting background to the history of Banjul
text: Artifacts, photos and reconstructions covering the history of Banjul and The Gambia. Suitable for a visit if around and hour. Small museum but covers interesting aspects of history.

title: One of the smallest national museums I have ever been to.
text: This is one of the smallest national museums I have ever been to, but it was not a let-down. Crammed full of objects and displays it attempts to convey the prehistory, pre-colonial, colonial and post-colonial story of this country that looks like a finger into Senegal. The museum does demonstrate the divisiveness of colonialism. If in a somewhat haphazard and no-strings manner.

title: Gambian National Museum
text: Our tour guides were very knowledgeable regarding the artefacts in the museum. Both Hadden and Omar were extremely nice, patients and great people to speak with. Thank you for the time you took to explain the different areas in the museum and for explaining what happened during the different dispensation in your beautiful country.

title: Must see
text: The short and outdated exhibition, but essential to understand the origins of The Gambia state. Interesting artefacts but everything is a bit dusted and crammed. Still worth visiting.

title: Een lovenswaardig initiatief
text: Met beperkte middelen toch een interessant overzicht van de oertijd tot de hedendaagse tijd. De Afrikaan die ons gezelschap hield, had de tranen in de ogen toen hij zijn eigen roots ontdekte

title: Intersting exhibits on the (colonial) history of Gambia
text:
Three floors of exibits, sketching the (colonial) history of The Gambia. We were here as part of a group tour, but free to wander on our own. Most exhibits have an explanation an English nearby.
Stairs ony, no lift.

title: Väldigt litet.
text:
Var inne i 1 minut. Inte mycket för oss att se på. Lite historiska föremål desto mer skriven information. 
En silversmed på innergården som var mer sevärd för oss.

title: Lots of reading
text: It’s a small museum but with a ton of material to read. It was interesting for me to see some of the items that originated from my country and had been adopted by the Gambians. It’s worth going to and having a look about. I think it’s advisable to make this one of your fist stops whilst in Gambia so that one can understand the country better.

title: A summary of Gambian culture and history
text: When in Banjul, take a look into this small but fairly well organized museum over Gambian history and a glimpse of the local culture.

title: Well curated little museum
text: The  exhibits in this small museum have surprising scope and depth with lots of black and white photos, maps, costumes, instruments and prehistoric stone tools - but no masks.  Some to the themes include weaving done by men, ceramics by women, Gesseh wedding rituals, shell mound burials, tribal languages and  the slave trade.  On the negative side, the display cases appeared very dusty and some of the exhibits were very dated - with explanations that appeared to be prepared using a type writer!  Recommend.

title: Interessant maar stoffig museum
text: Dit historisch museum laat vele facetten zien vanaf de prehistorie tot aan de recente presidentverkiezingen. Het behandelt vele onderwerpen in een notendop. De slavenhandel wordt ook summier belicht. James Island in de Gambia rivier was het vertrekpunt van de slaven richting Amerika. Het was verrassend te ontdekken dat de Islam al sinds het jaar 1000 aanwezig is. Er zijn vele moskees in het land te vinden.

title: National Museum
text: Main Museum set back from a garden .there is a small entrance fee.poor lighting no aircon /unbearably hot. Some items /pictures are worth a look.but generally disappointing. The Museum artifacts are not kept in good condition

title: Gambia in a house
text: The National museum which is located in Banjul offers visitors to revisit the ancient past of The Gambia. The museum chronicles all aspect of Gambian life and how people used to live 1000s of years ago. My journey to this historic museum was very interesting as I had the chance to know more about the real Gambian culture and way of life.

title: Bezoek waard
text: Leuk museum, zeker als je in Banjul bent een bezoekje waard. Je kan uitleg krijgen van een gids. Maar als je met een taxi gaat dan kan de chauffeur je het ook uitstekend uitleggen. Er komen ook hele schoolklassen naar dit museum.

title: Introduction to Gambia's history
text: The collection is rather small but reading the info text will give you a brief understanding about the country's past. The only employee was friendly and helpful. There are some postcards, books and other merchandise for sale.

title: Worth a visit
text: Located in an old colonial building it is home to historical documents and displays concerning the Gambia. There is a 50D (1 Euro) admission fee. Visited in the morning but I returned later that day for a nice stay in the garden, as Banjul has no parks.
